  • Drugs

TERLIPRESSIN ACETATE

  • Pregnancy
  • Renal impairment
  • Side effects
  • Cautions
  • Medicinal forms

Advice when patient is pregnant

Avoid unless benefits outweigh risk—uterine contractions and increased intra-uterine pressure in early pregnancy, and decreased uterine blood flow reported.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Use with caution in chronic renal failure.

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Abdominal cramps, arrhythmia, bradycardia, diarrhoea, headache, hypertension, hypotension, pallor, peripheral ischaemia,

uncommon: Angina, bronchospasm, convulsions, hot flushes, hyponatraemia, intestinal ischaemia, myocardial infarction, nausea, pulmonary oedema, respiratory failure, tachycardia, vomiting,

rare: Dyspnoea,

veryRare: Hyperglycaemia, stroke,

notKnown: Heart failure, skin necrosis,

Cautions regarding administration

  • Arrhythmia
  • elderly
  • electrolyte and fluid disturbances
  • heart disease
  • history of QT-interval prolongation
  • respiratory disease
  • septic shock
  • uncontrolled hypertension
  • vascular disease

Prepared medicinal forms of TERLIPRESSIN ACETATE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Solution for injection
Powder and solvent for solution for injection
